titleStmt.title: J. R. Thomas et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2287

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Lebanon Nov 264/1863
Governor Bramlette
Dear sir &

There is a vacancy in the office of Justice of the peace in the New Market District -- John Caffey is an applicant for the position He is loyal and true and fully competent to discharge the duties pertainin to the office -- You would gratify the loyal men of the magistrate district (which is No 3) By appointing him to the office -- Direct commission to New Market, Marion Co Ky -- Your &c

J. R. Thomas
A. Bicket
James A Jarboe
J M Fidler Clk M. Co. ct
Constable of the Sam District G. W. Hudson

Issue Coms
as Recommended
Tho E Bramlette
